duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform advanced professional forestry functions in the field and office, including tree pruning, removal, planting, and replacement.
Supervise employees and contractors involved in professional forestry activities and enforce Parks Department standards for tree care.
Consult with engineers, developers, and contractors on ecological and horticulture initiatives.
Conduct inspections and field surveys to assess tree health, structure, pests, diseases, and construction impacts.
Manage forestry contracts, including tree maintenance, removal, planting, sidewalk repair, and natural area restoration.
Review schedules, reports, and correspondence related to forestry activities and contracts.
Review permit applications, assess impacts to trees and landscapes, advise applicants, and issue permits.
Manage forestry databases and produce reports on budgets, productivity, accomplishments, and program status updates.
Respond to citizen inquiries, maintain relationships with community groups, and coordinate community-based greening efforts and tree stewardship workshops.

education_certification.credential: A master’s degree from an accredited college or university, with a specialization in forestry or a related subject; or a baccalaureate degree with one year of full-time professional experience in forestry; or an associate degree with three years of full-time professional experience in forestry.
